definition: (idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
surname Zhi
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
surname Wu
I/my (old)
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Stop stalling and answer my question.
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其词避免回答一切问题。

sentences.english: She manages to wriggle out of answering all the questions .
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其词避免回答一切问题。

sentences.english: Fogg's project as madness; the Daily Telegraph alone hesitatingly supported him.
sentences.chinese: 唯独《每日电讯报》在支吾其词地支持着福格。

sentences.english: The minister stumbled over the major question.
sentences.chinese: 部长对主要问题支吾其词。

sentences.english: She managed to wriggle out of answering all the questions.
sentences.chinese: 她支吾其词制止回答一切题目。

definition: to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
to offer excuses (colloquial)/to stall
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to resist/to deal with
to reveal the truth/to spill the beans
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to debate/to argue
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to refuse to meet sb/to avoid sb
to deny flatly
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
